Title: [L04] Rounding down in OUSD calculations
Content:
When transferring tokens, the `OUSD` contract [translates](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bf4ff28d5944ecc277e66294fd2c702fee5cd58b/contracts/contracts/token/OUSD.sol#L142-L143) the token amount to the equivalent number of credits. However, the value is rounded down in both directions. As a general principle, to minimize the attack surface, rounding errors should be in favor of the protocol. Consider using the [`mulTruncateCeil` function](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bf4ff28d5944ecc277e66294fd2c702fee5cd58b/contracts/contracts/utils/StableMath.sol#L81) to calculate `creditsDeducted`.


Similarly, consider using the `mulTruncateCeil` function when [calculating the number of credits to burn](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bf4ff28d5944ecc277e66294fd2c702fee5cd58b/contracts/contracts/token/OUSD.sol#L298). This would also remove the need to [check for rounding errors](https://github.com/OriginProtocol/origin-dollar/blob/bf4ff28d5944ecc277e66294fd2c702fee5cd58b/contracts/contracts/token/OUSD.sol#L303) when burning the whole balance.


**Update:** *Not fixed. The Origin team states:*



> We are going to keep this as is for now. While rounding in the protocol’s favor is generally good, any rounding against the users’ transfer, mint, and burn amounts gets quite painful for users. Users expect that if they send someone X, the recipient will get X, and that if they want to keep Y, and they send their balance minus Y, that they will still have Y. The amounts involved are trillionths of a trillionth of a dollar, and OUSD has a flow of yield coming into it.
>
